page.title: 05The Court
page.content: Before the building was a magistrates court it was a police station and was built in 1870.There were 4 cells in the building.These were called uncertified cells because nobody was allowed to stay in them overnight because there are no facillities for them. The main courtroom has a long very high bench at the far end with the Royal Crest over the top of it.There can be a maximum of 7 magistrates,and a minimum of 2 can be asked to sit.The accused stands in the dock.The other large room,again a court room,was the juniville court. This is where offenders from the age 10- 17 are brought before the magistrates. The court sits daily with the exeption of Thursday.20% of all crimes can be tried at this court.The maximum penalty that someone can have is 6 months in prison.
